resource.chars:
repeated comparisons.
Tick. <u>Polaris<\u> is shown 
on all my photographs of it 
which have been exposed 
for 30 minutes and upwards 
on clear nights to be surround-
ed by nebulosity which I 
also see when viewing it 
with a low power in my 
seven inch refractor, but
I hesitate to pronounce 
that the effect is not 
due to atmospheric causes 
and will only suggest 
that it <u>may<\u> be an ac-
companiment of the star.
It is not due to halation
